Title:
One new Pochonia species (Clavicipitaceae), two new
variations of P. chlamydosporia and one first recorded species from
soils in Japan
Keywords:
D1/D2, ITS, Oceanic islands, Pochonia, Soil-inhabiting
fungi, Subtropics, Taxonomy
Abstract:
Fifty Pochonia strains were isolated from soil samples
collected in various locations in Japan. Using a combination of
micro-morphological characters and ITS and multi-gene (nr SSU, nr LSU,
EF1-Î±, RPB1 and RPB2) phylogeny, the isolates were classified as seven
taxa, three of which were previously undescribed, and one of them was a
first record in Japan. The new species P. boninensis and two new
varieties of P. chlamydosporia var. ellipsospora and var. spinulospora
were recovered from the Chichi-jima, Aogashima, or Okinawaâs main
island. The three new taxa are distinguished from known species and
varieties by conidial morphology. The finding of P. rubescens was a
first for Japan.
